clinical_study.brief_title: Pancreas Cancer Surveillance Using an Abbreviated MRI
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Feasibility of Abbreviated MRI for Surveillance in High Risk Group for Developing Pancreas Cancer: A Prospective Cohort Study

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to establish a prospective cohort of developing pancreas cancer and surveillance MRI protocol. With the focused surveillance protocol, we perform surveillance for pancreas cancer for five years to estimate the risk of pancreas cancer and the clinical feasibility of the surveillance MRI.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 year after the last surveillance MRI.
primary_outcome.description: number of detected pancreas cancer (resectable & BRPC only) in surveillance MRI.

secondary_outcome.measure: Scan time of abbreviated PB MRI for surveillance
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 month after the first surveillance MRI.
secondary_outcome.description: table time, in-room time measurement for feasibility

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 year after the last surveillance MRI.
secondary_outcome.description: rate of developing pancreas cancer during the study period

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 year after the last surveillance MRI.
secondary_outcome.description: number of detected pancreas cancer of all stages (resectable, BRPC, LAPC, metastatic) in surveillance MRI.

other_outcome.measure: Comparison of performance of abbreviated PB MRI
other_outcome.time_frame: 1 year after the last surveillance MRI.
other_outcome.description: comparison of the rates of pancreas cancer detection between abbreviated MRI and conventional follow-up methods (in available cases)

other_outcome.measure: Identification of super-high risk group of developing pancreas cancer
other_outcome.time_frame: 1 year after the last surveillance MRI.
other_outcome.description: Identification of any common radiologic features and gene mutation in participants in whom pancreas cancer develop during the study period.

arm_group.description: Short and Focused non-contrast MRI for surveillance

intervention.description: K-ras and GNAS mutation test. Being performed once as a baseline test at the enrollment.
Any of followings: scheduled CECT, MRI, USG, EUS, tumor marker (CA 19-9) during the study period.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- On follow-up due to first degree-family history of PAC
- Or on follow-up for BD-IPMN (>= 2 cm) or main-duct type IPMN (> 5 mm)
- And signed informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Contra-indication of performing MRI
- Not satisfying the selection criteria.
- Previously diagnosed with pancreatic malignancy
- Pregnancy or planning pregnancy
